detail.content: Showing II/III: Nov 13th - Nov 15th: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Dance Chair's Message / Social Undergraduate Graduate Course Offerings News & Events Performances Dance & New Media Live Summer High School Second Avenue Dance Company Alumni Current Students Admin & Faculty  home > Dance        Showing II/III: Nov 13th - Nov 15th  Showing II/III November 13th-15th, 8pm 111 2nd Avenue Fifth Floor Theater    Each year Tisch Dance presents five Showings. These Showings are opportunities for students - from both the Bachelor's and Master's degree programs - to perform and choreograph. Supervised by our experienced faculty, these showings are comprised entirely of student choreographers and serve as a means through which students experiment with different aesthetics, styles, and concepts of dance. Lasting around an hour and a half, the Showings are performed with full lights, costumes, and music in the fifth floor theater at 111 2nd Avenue, and are a wonderful display of the individuality, ingenuity, and intelligence of the dancers and choreographers at Tisch.      Choreographers: Mirela Amaral, Rohan Bhargava, Willa Brown, Angie Conte, Lukas Dellios, David Gourov, Mathew James, Stephanie Kies, Kyle Mullins, Carley Santori, Lauren Settembrino, Bridget Struthers, Hyung Ji Yu, Xiang Xu, Yachao Zhu.  RESERVE TICKETS NOW! Creative Research in Dance III: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Dance Chair's Message / Social Undergraduate Graduate Course Offerings News & Events Performances Dance & New Media Live Summer High School Second Avenue Dance Company Alumni Current Students Admin & Faculty  home > Dance        Creative Research in Dance III  DANC-UT.1005 Studio 2 - 8 Credits Instructor(s): Lamhut, Faculty Open only to students in the Department of Dance.    These courses comprise creative work including choreography and performance. Choreography is approached through exploration of resources, including improvisation, use of ideas, knowledge of forms, development of craft. First-year students receive weekly assignments directed toward specific problems and dance elements. Second-year work develops with an emphasis on the relationship between manipulation of musical phrases and choreography as well as the completion of dances. Work begun in all composition classes may be performed in studio theatre concerts. Other performance opportunities derive from repertory classes, performance workshops, and major dance works choreographed by faculty and guest choreographers that are assigned and also from student and faculty choreography pursued independently outside of course work. Curriculum Model: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Dance Chair's Message / Social Undergraduate Graduate Course Offerings News & Events Performances Dance & New Media Live Summer High School Second Avenue Dance Company Alumni Current Students Admin & Faculty  home > Dance        B.F.A. Curriculum Model  First Year    Dance Technique I Creative Research in Dance I Music Theory and Composition Kinesthetics of Anatomy Production Crew in Dance Art and The World The World Through Art General education courses Summer: 6 Week Dance Residency    Second Year    Dance Technique II Creative Research in Dance II Improvisation Music Literature Acting History of Dance Production Crew in Dance General education courses Summer: 6 Week Dance Residency    Third Year    Second Avenue Dance Company Dance Technique III Creative Research in Dance III Production Crew in Dance General education courses Optional departmental electives (by advisement only)    General Education Component Points    Art and the World The World through Art Social Science/Natural Science Humanities General Education Courses (nonarts) Total: 32    Total Points for Completion: 128 B.F.A.
